sentence.text: V-6 (25 years) had height of 90 cm, respectively.
Arm span of 30–36 cm was noted.
They exhibited short, bowed and deformed radius and ulna.
The ulnae being shorter with mildly dislocated radii.
Carpals, metacarpals, tarsals, metatarsals and phalangeal bones were very poorly ossified and underdeveloped.
Carpals and metacarpals were hypo-plastic, distorted and had no connections with the phalanges (Fig. 2k).
Radiographic examination of carpals, metacarpals and phalanges showed complete agenesis.
All five distal phalanges with intact nails were present; however, proximal and middle phalanges were completely missing (Fig. 2c–k).
Knee joints showed cubitus valgus deformity (Fig. 2j).
Angle of acetabulofemoral joint was marked as coxa valga (Fig. 2i).
Both the femurs were short, with broad distal metaphyses, and twisted left femur.
The tibiae and fibulae were bowed, twisted and extremely short.
Ankle joints showed severe valgus instability (Fig. 2j).
Polydactyly and vertebral deformity was not observed in any affected members.
Intelligence, facial appearance, trunk, skull, spinal cord, and ribs were normal
